comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: news.google.com/newspapers?id=AvsgAAAAIBAJ&sjid=cnUFA... books.google.com/books?id=HvdQAAAAYAAJ&lpg=PA29&o... news.google.com/newspapers?id=x_sgAAAAIBAJ&sjid=kXUFA... news.google.com/newspapers?id=-_ZGAAAAIBAJ&sjid=F_gMA... A Chicago man, Cosgrove was planning a trip around the world, in a 36-foot lifeboat, leaving from Columbia Yacht Club in New York. The two men in the photo are his entire crew; he was also traveling with his wife and a "motion picture photographer." (Mrs. Cosgrove wasn't along for the long stretches; she planned to take more traditional forms of transport to meet the Captain along the route.) Can't find much about whether they made it, or how far they made it...

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: See also The New York Times, October 28, 1915 (last article: LIFEBOAT TO CIRLE GLOBE) P.S.: Joseph Jesiek is the correct name (not Jesick)
